You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Set Private Properties on the ccrz.cc_CallContext Object

Salesforce API changed to strictly enforce private properties on objects. As a result, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now requires any subscriber code that directly sets properties on the ccrz.cc_CallContext object to instead use appropriate initialization methods.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: Migrate any subscriber code that directly sets properties on the ccrz.cc_CallContext object to use the ccrz.cc_CallContext.init() and ccrz.cc_CallContext.initRemoteContext() methods.

For example, let’s say that your subscriber code directly sets a property:

ccrz.cc_CallContext.storefront = 'MyStore'

Update your code to use the initRemoteContext method:

cc_RemoteActionContext ctx = new cc_RemoteActionContext();
ctx.storefront = 'MyStore';
cc_RemoteActionResult result = cc_CallContext.init(ctx);
SEE ALSO
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.cc_CallContext

title: Migrating Subscriber Code for B2B Commerce Visualforce
